author: Deccan
title: The L16: 16 cameras in one camera!
text:
Deccan Chronicle | October 18, 2015, 23.49 pm Each of those circles packs in a 13MP camera. There’s a brand new camera out there that’s pushing all competition out of the frame. The L16, by a company called Light, has 16 different circles on its front. If this thing’s pointing at you, there’s not escape.
Behind each circle is a 13MP camera module and the L16 can summon every bit of image information to generate one massive image...52 megapixels big. From a basic point and-shoot, that’s unheard of! No wonder then Light founder Rajiv Laroia is calling it “a silent revolution”.
When compared to other cameras, Light claims the L16 will pack in more details and yes, can thrash today’s phone cameras. But with an asking price of $1,699, it’s rather expensive too and since the company is planning to make just a thousand of these, it will be rare too! What could be better though? Add a phone function to it, perhaps?
